lessonInfo: Tanwīn: Tanwīn consists of the signs double Fatha ( ً ), double Kasra ( ٍ ), and double Damma ( ٌ ), which add a final "n" sound to a word. In Arabic, Tanwīn appears only at the end of nouns.
Double Fatha ( ً ): Written above the letter. For letters other than Tāʾ Marbūṭa (ة) and Hamza (ء), it is written on a supporting Alif (ا). It is pronounced as "-an".
